questions.question_text: Which of the following tables exist within the GRC: Profiles application scope? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
textbook P115
Entity / Entity type/ Entity class are in GRC:Profiles scope.

Selected Answer: ABE
Answer:
 A. sn_grc_profile_type
 B. sn_grc_indicator
 E. sn_grc_profile_class
Explanation: tables names and scope
 - Entity Type[sn_grc_profile_type] | GRC: Profiles
 - Indicator[sn_grc_indicator] | GRC: Profiles
 - sn_grc_compliance_policy_statement doesn't exist, instead Control objective[sn_compliance_policy_statement] | GRC: Policy and Compliance Management exists
 - sn_grc_risk_definition doesn't exist, instead Risk Statement[sn_risk_definition] | GRC: Risk Management exists
 - Entity Class[sn_grc_profile_class] | GRC: Profiles
Source: PDI, sys_db_object list view

questions.question_text: Who can move a Policy record from Review into the next state?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The choice with least priviliges who can perform this task is the Policy Owner. 

Anyone from the Owning Group with sn_compliance.manager or the admin can move the policy to "Awaiting Approval". 

C: Only named reviewer can move the policy to next state and not any reviewer. 
FYI: There is no role called Policy Owner

Selected Answer: D
reviewer can add comment and move back to draft, whereas, Policy owner only can move it to next state.

Selected Answer: D
eBook, SanDiego - Page 153
Only Policy Owner can move Policy to awaiting approval
The named policy Owner. Only policy owners can move the policy to awaiting approval, compliance managers can only do so if they have the policy owner role.

Selected Answer: D
named policy owner or reviewer (not any) so it should be D

Selected Answer: C
Textbook P126
Compliance users and above can move policies into review.

comments.content: While in Review, reviewers can either send policy back to draft or move it forward by requesting approval.
named policy owner or reviewer (not any) so it should be D

questions.question_text: Which table extends from the Content Table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer: D. Risk Statement
Explanation: Content[sn_grc_content] extends to
 - Citation[sn_complance_citation]
 - Control object requirement[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
 - Risk Statment[sn_risk_definition]
 - Control object[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
Source: PDI, sys_db_object Content[sn_grc_content] Schema Map

choices.C: A control is automatically generated for every Entity listed in the Entity Type
choices.A: An assessment is automatically generated to test each Entity listed in the Entity Type
choices.D: The Entity Type presents a compliance score and controls tied to it
choices.B: A policy is created automatically for every Entity listed in the Entity Type

questions.question_text: What happens when you assign an Entity Type to a Control Objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
Textbook P79
Company/Department/Location/Services/Database Instance/Group/Business Process..
